title: 107_hr3920
content: The "Rancher Preservation Act" may require special provisions for the black-tailed prairie dog under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. The Secretary must use the best scientific and commercial data available to determine the status of the black-tailed prairie dog under the Endangered Species Act. This includes giving greater weight to empirical or peer-reviewed data and considering population numbers of the species. Field data is required to support any determination of the species as endangered or threatened. The Secretary must use the best scientific and commercial data available, including field data, to determine the status of the black-tailed prairie dog under the Endangered Species Act. Landowners' data collected through observation must be acknowledged and included in the rulemaking record for any determination of the species as endangered or threatened. Independent scientific review requirements are defined in this subsection. In this subsection, definitions are provided for terms like "action" and "qualified individual," with a focus on expertise in biological sciences for the latter. In biological sciences, a qualified individual must demonstrate expertise on the black-tailed prairie dog or a similar species relevant to the Secretary's decision, without conflicts of interest or involvement in related petitions or determinations, and no direct financial interests. The Secretary appoints independent scientific reviewers from a list developed with recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences to review actions before final decisions are made. The Secretary appoints 3 qualified individuals to review and report on scientific information for proposed actions. Reviewers are compensated for their independent review and must provide their opinion within 3 months. The selection and activities of the reviewers are not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The Secretary appoints 3 qualified individuals to review scientific information for proposed actions. Reviewers must provide their opinion within 3 months. The final determination includes a summary of the independent scientific review and an explanation if the recommendation is not followed. The report of the peer reviewers is available for public review before the close of the proposed action. The official record of the proposed action will be available for public review before the comment period closes. A conforming amendment will be made to the table of sections in the Act. Special requirements for black-tailed prairie dog will be implemented.
